page.title: 01Weare and District
page.content: The predominant feature of the area is pasture land some of which is low lying heavy clay and the remainder reasonably drained higher ground. This dictated the early settlement pattern, which in turn has been affected latterly by the advent of the car, the M5 motorway and the Severn suspension bridge. The original hamlets and villages,part of the Bempstone Hundred and later the open field system, now have a mixture of modified or extended cottages and modern housing. The farms, once renowned for their dairy produce and cider making, now by a combination of goverment grants and E.E.C. milk quotas produce beef cattle, sheep , Friesian dairy cows and pigs. The farms vary from private ownership to rented farms from Somerset C.Council.
